|Belgium
|1950 Belgian monarchy referendum
|12 March 1950
| Whether King Leopold III should return, have his royal powers and duties restored and the regency of Prince Charles, Count of Flanders be terminated
| King Leopold III returned, with powers and duties restored
|57.68% in favor, 42.32% opposed
|92.92
|  King Leopold III gave up his powers and duties in August 1950, making his eldest son Baudouin, regent. Leopold III later abdicated in July 1951, in favour of Baudouin.

|1862 Greek head of state referendum
|19 November 1862
|Who if anyone should succeed Otto as King of the Hellenes after his deposition
| Prince Alfred of the United Kingdom should be installed as the new monarch

| Prince Alfred declined the Greek throne due to pressure from the British government and from his mother, Queen Victoria; Prince William of Denmark was later installed as George I of Greece.
